snippet: Fabio Capello, the Italian coach who was upset that John Terry had his captaincy stripped, resigned, but it’s unclear whether Harry Redknapp, a popular figure with his own troubles, will replace him.
abstract: Rob Hughes On Soccer column on resignation of England's soccer coach Fabio Capello, the Italian who has coached the English national team since 2008; Capello resigned in protest of his choice of team captain being overruled; it is unclear whether Tottenham Hotspur manager Harry Redknapp, a popular figure with his own troubles, will replace Capello.
lead_paragraph: Fabio Capello, the Italian coach who was upset that John Terry had his captaincy stripped, resigned, but it’s unclear whether Harry Redknapp, a popular figure with his own troubles, will replace him.

headline.seo: England Loses Capello, National Team Coach
headline.main: England Loses National Team Coach and Invites Uncertainty
headline.print_headline: England Loses National Team Coach and Invites Uncertainty
